Description: Two joining fragments of lower body of closed pottery vessel of cylindrical shape, probably a situla; lower part glazed, reserved above; light beige clay; inscribed.on wall.
Curator's comments: 0the analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn, placed the piece as a singleton.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.56 Table 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 160, NAU 133, pl. 29a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.710)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.125)
